results.title: The League of Nations: the first experiment
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and George Movshon
results.brief_description: Described as, by the titles, “An account of the first attempt by nations to build an organisation to maintain the peace.” Contains original footage from WWI re the armistice and political accounts of movements during the war.

results.title: The League of Nations: the decline and fall
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and George Movshon
results.brief_description: Describes the formation of the League of Nations shortly after the end of WWI. Also outlines related organisations such as the World Court and the International Labor Organisation. Describes the activities of Hitler, Mussilini and the Japanese invasion of China. The end of the League and the formation of the United Nations is also shown.

results.title: The League of gentlemen. Series 1
results.brief_description: The surreal tone of this critically acclaimed, off-beat British comedy set in the fictional North England town of Royston Vasey, has been described by one critic as “Monty Python meets Twin Peaks”. Diverging wildly from most sit-com conventions, the series features over sixty characters, practically every resident of the town, most of whom are played with remarkable skill by three core cast members. Ranging from mildly eccentric to plain psychotic, the townsfolk of Royston Vasey suffer from a particularly demented variety of disfunctionality and xenophobia. They include the local shopkeepers Edward and Tubbs, who go to murderous lengths to ensure their shop remains for local people only; the Denton family, toad-breeders obsessed with maintaining their household rituals at all costs; inept veterinary surgeon Dr Chinnery, who’s never yet saved a patient; Barbara, the local transsexual taxi driver (one of the show’s more well adjusted characters); Pauline the demonic Restart Officer at the local Job Centre; and Lance, the sadistic owner of Lance’s Joke Shop. The series had its origins in a live sketch comedy, then became an award-winning radio show before it moved to television where it has continued to win awards and has garnered a cult following. Written by Jeremy Dyson, Mark Gatiss, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith. Starring Mark Gatiss, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith.

results.title: The Lead matrix
results.brief_description: Shows various industrial uses of lead, including pipes, roofing, insulation against radiation, noise and vibration, caulking and sheathing, solder, printed circuits and battery plates. Lead compounds have many uses in glass, ceramics, plastics and fuel.

results.title: The Lead dress
results.brief_description: A beautiful, gothic film about a mother so desperate to keep her daughter at home that she sews her a lead dress which impedes her movement. Shot in black and white without dialogue, the film uses a form of pixillation which, when combined with slow-motion performance, gives the effect of its characters moving in a slow and jerky fashion while cars and people in the background flash past at high speed.

results.title: The Lawyers
results.brief_description: Filmed in various locations throughout England and Wales, this documentary shows real barristers and solicitors in their chambers and offices and in the Inns of Court. There are no actors. Ninety practising lawyers (necessarily anonymous) make frank comments as the film shows how the two branches of their profession work. The solicitors are seen as forming the greater part of the profession and doing all the legal business which does not reach the courts. Only barristers may appear in Court and they may not refuse a brief.

results.title: The Law of the sea
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Edward Magruder Jones and Gilbert Lauzun
results.brief_description: Stresses the need for international cooperation in developing a universally acceptable law of the sea, so that resource-use conflicts between nations such as the Icelandic “cod war” will not occur in the future. Shows the steps which have already been taken in this direction by countries bordering the North Sea. Suitabel for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Laundry
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Lesley Dyer and Alex Chomicz
results.brief_description: A woman’s trip to the laundromat takes a frightening turn when she encounters a man washing his blood stained clothes. Is he someone to fear? A comedic short film about first impressions and the persuasive power of appearance.

results.title: The Late Show: The Olden days
results.creator_credit: D Generation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Mark Gibson
results.brief_description: In the hands of the D-Generation the original ABC series of ‘Rush’ becomes a steamy tale of hope, betrayal and false moustaches set against the rarely-convincing backdrop of the Victorian ‘mudfields’. Also features a featurette at the end of “Olden Days” which is a tribute to that great Australian auteur Warren Perso (starring Tony Martin and Judith Lucy).
